bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Thomas Creigh was a member of the Virginia General Assembly. He was likely born in 1812, worked as a medical doctor, and served the legislature as a representative of Greenbrier County, Virginia (now West Virginia).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Thomas Creigh letter is a one‐page missive written in 1858 from a Virginia assemblyman, likely representing Greenbrier County, to an unknown party concerning the state of Virginia's indebtedness. Creigh proceeds to specifically cite Virginia's floating debt at eight hundred and fifty thousand dollars. Also mentioned are the unnamed correspondent's subscription to the Richmond paper, the unseasonably mild winter, and Virginia's internal improvement.
